intro: Chorizema callistachys, commonly known as the sweet flag, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found near water bodies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, spicy fragrance when crushed.
